timeline.bodyText: What's the benefit to specifying the runtime exception in the method header? Also, that won't force calling methods to catch/throw it will it?
timeline.author: TrekSoft

replies.bodyText:
My intention here was just to provide clear documentation on what can happen. Since IllegalStateException derives from RuntimeException, the caller still won't need to try-catch it explicitly.
However, I didn't honestly know the best practice on this. Should one put runtime exceptions on the method signature, or not? Apparently, the guidance is to not do this. Here's a StackOverflow post about it, which contains this quote from Oracle documentation:

Having to add runtime exceptions in every method declaration would reduce a program's clarity.

Anyway, these are all over the code-base at this point. I'll do a separate CR to remove them all in one pass.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams
